title: Aspiring Technology Guru
address: 476 E. Aspen Meadows Ct Millcreek Utah, 84107
summary: Driven by a relentless work ethic and an unwavering commitment to innovation, I have consistently excelled across diverse professional environments. With a robust background in program management within the non-profit sector, I transitioned seamlessly into the realm of business intelligence and data analytics within higher education. Here, I have demonstrated a penchant for introducing innovative ideas and methodologies that ensure the success of programs and initiatives. Fusing my expertise in social science with a profound understanding of information technology and analytics, I adopt a highly analytical and strategic approach to problem-solving. My overarching objectives revolve around further honing my skills in data science, information technology, and leadership to drive impactful change and foster continuous growth.

certifications.title: Oracle Certified Associate, Java SE 8 Programmer

roles.title: Institutional Effectivenes, Interim Vice President
roles.description: As Interim Vice President of Institutional Effectiveness, I oversee multiple key functions within the college to ensure alignment with strategic objectives and regulatory compliance. This includes leading the Enrollment Council in implementing enrollment plans and steering the Data Governance Council to uphold data quality, access, and security standards. Additionally, I supervise the Data Science and Analytics department, responsible for developing research products, and the Strategy and Analysis department, which drives strategic planning, assessment, and accreditation efforts to support SLCC's mission and vision.

roles.title: Data Science and Analytics, Director
roles.description: Led, mentored, and supervised a multidisciplinary team of data analysts, engineers, and researchers, overseeing strategic data projects and addressing inquiries from internal and external stakeholders. Managed essential data products aligned with organizational goals and advocated for data-informed practices. Spearheaded the development of a data exploration application used by over 1500 faculty members and division deans, significantly enhancing student analytics. Additionally, implemented an enterprise-level business intelligence platform to provide actionable insights, improve data quality, and enhance visibility and transparency across the organization.

roles.title: Business Analytics, Assistant Director
roles.description: In my role as the Business Analytics Assistant Director, I oversaw the development of enterprise data dashboards and applications. I led, mentored, and supervised a team of business analysts, ensuring their professional growth and the success of our projects. Additionally, I managed strategic initiatives and handled ad hoc data requests efficiently. I built relationships with the Information Technology department to ensure secure and seamless data delivery to our stakeholders.

roles.title: Business Intelligence Administrator
roles.description: Responsible for researching program, process, and technological improvements and innovations that will (1) foster improved data quality and reporting; (2) eliminate redundancies; (3) streamline current data collection activities or work processes; and (4) facilitate data driven decision making. Worked collaboratively with a team of subject matter experts to build data visualizations, interactive web sites, and dashboards necessary for monitoring performance and reporting to leadership and department stake-holders.

roles.title: Information Technology and Data Analytics, Director
roles.description: Primary responsibilities included maintaining the organization's client database and information technology infrastructure. Worked to develop metrics and supported efforts for effective data collection across a wide variety of programs and initiatives. Involved in performing analytical tasks, research and designing visualizations of internal and external data sources to inform performance, strategic planning, and funding accountability. Lastly, as a technical expert I was responsible for the network and information technology administration, web maintenance, and technical training.

roles.title: Outcomes and Program Manager
roles.description: Expand and improve existing programs to meet state and federal standards and maintain funding. Develop and maintain a system to track program output and outcome data effectively using logic models, project planning methodologies and program evaluation theories. Report program performance to key stakeholders including governing board, grantors and partners.

details.title: Interview: Preschool Impact on Early Elementary School Educational Outcomes
details.subtitle: Research the impact of preschool program on children's educational outcomes using mix-methods research.
